description: Converts the given `ZonedDateTime` into the user's local time zone.

calendar.description: The calendar system associated with this date, e.g. Gregorian.
calendar.name: calendar

era.description: The calendar era for this date, e.g. "BC" or "AD".
era.name: era

year.description: The year of this date within the era.
year.name: year

month.description:
The month number within the year. Note that some calendar systems such as Hebrew
may have a variable number of months per year. Therefore, month numbers may not
always correspond to the same month names in different years.
month.name: month

day.description: The day number within the month.
day.name: day

hour.description: The hour in the day, numbered from 0 to 23.
hour.name: hour

timeZone.description: The IANA time zone identifier that this date and time is represented in.
timeZone.name: timeZone

offset.description: The UTC offset for this time, in seconds.
offset.name: offset

copy.description: Returns a copy of this date.
copy.name: copy

add.description: Returns a new `ZonedDateTime` with the given duration added to it.
add.name: add

subtract.description: Returns a new `ZonedDateTime` with the given duration subtracted from it.
subtract.name: subtract

set.description: Returns a new `ZonedDateTime` with the given fields set to the provided values. Other fields will be constrained accordingly.
set.name: set

type.name: (fields: DateFields & TimeFields, disambiguation?: Disambiguation | undefined) => ZonedDateTime

cycle.description:
Returns a new `ZonedDateTime` with the given field adjusted by a specified amount.
When the resulting value reaches the limits of the field, it wraps around.
cycle.name: cycle

type.name: (field: keyof DateFields | keyof TimeFields, amount: number, options?: CycleTimeOptions | undefined) => ZonedDateTime

toDate.description: Converts the date to a native JavaScript Date object.
toDate.name: toDate

toString.description: Converts the date to an ISO 8601 formatted string, including the UTC offset and time zone identifier.
toString.name: toString

toAbsoluteString.description: Converts the date to an ISO 8601 formatted string in UTC.
toAbsoluteString.name: toAbsoluteString

compare.description: Compares this date with another. A negative result indicates that this date is before the given one, and a positive date indicates that it is after.
compare.name: compare
